titles.title: Grain Size Data for Sediment Core WGZ-GC-1 (Ross Ice Sheet, Antarctica)

resource.publisher: EarthChem Library(ECL) | Interdisciplinary Earth Data Alliance (IEDA) | Columbia University; doi:10.17616/R3V644

rightsList.rights: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0]

descriptions.description: Grain size fraction and thermal conductivity every 1 cm along sediment core WGZ-GC-1. Grain sizes below 1 mm diameter were measured with a laser-diffraction particle size analyzer, and grain sizes above 1 mm diameter were wet-sieved and weighed. Thermal conductivity measured using the needle probe method. At the time of core collection, January 2015, the site was located 3 km downstream of the Whillans ice stream Grounding Zone below a 10m seawater cavity of the Ross Ice Shelf. Lat: -84.335294 Lon: -163.612566

Related publications: Carolyn Branecky Begeman, Slawek Tulaczyk, Andrew T. Fisher, (2017), "Spatially variable geothermal heat flux in West Antarctica: evidence and implications." Geophysical Research Letters.

geoLocation.geoLocationPlace: Ross Ice Shelf, Ross Sea, West Antarctica, Whillans Ice Stream
